title: Google\Cloud\Video\Stitcher\V1\VodSession
name: VodSession
description:
Metadata for a VOD session.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.video.stitcher.v1.VodSession

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. The name of the VOD session, in the form of projects/{project_number}/locations/{location}/vodSessions/{id}.

params.name: data.interstitials
params.description: Output only. Metadata of what was stitched into the content.

params.name: data.play_uri
params.description: Output only. The playback URI of the stitched content.

params.name: data.source_uri
params.description: Required. URI of the media to stitch.

params.name: data.ad_tag_macro_map
params.description: Key value pairs for ad tag macro replacement. If the specified ad tag URI has macros, this field provides the mapping to the value that will replace the macro in the ad tag URI. Macros are designated by square brackets. For example: Ad tag URI: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=[geoId]" Ad tag macro map: {"geoId": "123"} Fully qualified ad tag: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=123"`

params.name: data.client_ad_tracking
params.description: Indicates whether client side ad tracking is enabled. If client side ad tracking is enabled, then the client player is expected to trigger playback and activity events itself. If this is set to false, server side ad tracking is enabled, causing the Video Stitcher service will trigger playback events on behalf of the client player.

params.name: data.manifest_options
params.description: Additional options that affect the output of the manifest.

params.name: data.asset_id
params.description: Output only. The generated ID of the VodSession's source media.

methods.name: getAdTagMacroMap
methods.description:
Key value pairs for ad tag macro replacement. If the specified ad tag URI has macros, this field provides the mapping to the value that will replace the macro in the ad tag URI.

Macros are designated by square brackets. For example: Ad tag URI: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=[geoId]" Ad tag macro map: {"geoId": "123"} Fully qualified ad tag: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=123"`

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> ad_tag_macro_map = 7;

methods.name: setAdTagMacroMap
methods.description:
Key value pairs for ad tag macro replacement. If the specified ad tag URI has macros, this field provides the mapping to the value that will replace the macro in the ad tag URI.

Macros are designated by square brackets. For example: Ad tag URI: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=[geoId]" Ad tag macro map: {"geoId": "123"} Fully qualified ad tag: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=123"`

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> ad_tag_macro_map = 7;

params.name: var
params.description:
Key value pairs for ad tag macro replacement. If the specified ad tag URI has macros, this field provides the mapping to the value that will replace the macro in the ad tag URI.

Macros are designated by square brackets. For example: Ad tag URI: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=[geoId]" Ad tag macro map: {"geoId": "123"} Fully qualified ad tag: "https://doubleclick.google.com/ad/1?geo_id=123"`

methods.name: getClientAdTracking
methods.description:
Indicates whether client side ad tracking is enabled. If client side ad tracking is enabled, then the client player is expected to trigger playback and activity events itself.

If this is set to false, server side ad tracking is enabled, causing the Video Stitcher service will trigger playback events on behalf of the client player.

Generated from protobuf field bool client_ad_tracking = 8;

methods.description:

Generated from protobuf field bool client_ad_tracking = 8;
